title: Iceland's president wants to ban pineapple from pizza
text:
Iceland's president wants to ban pineapple from pizza Last updated 11:50, February 22 2017 123rf 
Pineapple on pizza is just one of those things people are very passionate about. 
Olives, anchovies, capers or mushrooms - there are plenty of pizza toppings that have people divided. 
But one has been getting plenty of heat lately - pineapple - and even the Icelandic President has weighed in, saying he would ban the tropical fruit from pizza. 
President Gudni Th. Johannesson​ spoke to students at a high school in the northern icelandic town of Akureyri, later taking questions. SCANPIX DENMARK 
President of Iceland Gudni Johannesson, right, with Crown Prince Frederik of Denmark, has made his tastes clear. 
The all important, and divisive, question of whether pineapple belongs on pizza was answered by the president, who said he was "fundamentally opposed" to the idea. 
READ MORE: 
Social media leapt to the president's side, as he was criticised for his not-so-sweet pizza diplomacy. The President of Iceland wants to ban pineapple on pizza. This man should, obviously, be put in charge of the whole world. — Amanda (@Pandamoanimum) February 21, 2017 
But whether or not it could actually be banned is out of the question, he later clarified. 
On Tuesday, the president clarified his stance on Facebook: "I like pineapples, just not on pizza. I do not have the power to make laws which forbid people to put pineapples on their pizza. I am glad that I do not hold such power". 
"Presidents should not have unlimited power. I would not want to hold this position if I could pass laws forbidding that which I don't like. I would not want to live in such a country." 
And with that all cleared up, the president annoyed others with his preferred choice of topping: seafood. @AlbertoNardelli "Not pineapple, yet shellfish". I guess Italy is recalling its ambassador anyway. — Thiago Ferrer Morini (@tferrerm) February 21, 2017 @AlbertoNardelli @felixsalmon Seafood? He better only mean anchovies or IMPEACH. — billiecat (@billiecat) February 21, 2017 
All the while, in Sweden it's normal to put banana on pizza. Oh yeah, that banana #pizza I had in #Sweden ? It had pineapple on it too. Suck it haters. pic.twitter.com/TgQLK5Hb5B — Buck Est. 1999 (@MintzBuck) February 10, 2017
